class pricingengine.variables.const_var.ConstVar(interaction_levels=None)¶

Bases: pricingengine.variables.var_builder.VarBuilder

Measure impact of a unit’s own treatment value

__init__(interaction_levels=None)¶

Creates a ConstVar class which can be used to create a constant variable and corresponding interactions

Parameters:interaction_levels – List of column names (CATEGORICAL OR NUMERIC) used to interact with the core_variable

pricingengine.variables.own_past_agg_var module¶

class pricingengine.variables.own_past_agg_var.OwnPastAggVar(treatment_column, geometric_weight, min_lag=None, max_lag=None, min_seasonal_diff=None, max_seasonal_diff=None, interaction_levels=None, unpenalize_core_treatment=False, scale_core=True)¶

Bases: pricingengine.variables.var_builder.VarBuilder

Measure treatment impacts of a unit’s own treatment aggregated across multiple time periods useing geometric decay

__init__(treatment_column, geometric_weight, min_lag=None, max_lag=None, min_seasonal_diff=None, max_seasonal_diff=None, interaction_levels=None, unpenalize_core_treatment=False, scale_core=True)¶

Initialize a new FeatureBuilder for datasets with the specified schema

Parameters:
  • treatment_column – The residualized treatment that will be used for treatment generation
  • geometric_weight – multiplicative decay applied to periods with progressively greater lag
  • min_lag – The smallest lag to use in generating the treatment
  • max_lag – The largest lag to use in generating the treatment
  • interaction_levels – List of lists. Each sub-list is a list of columns that will be collectively interacted. If a sub-list is of length 2, this correspodns to a second-order interaction.
  • unpenalize_core_treatment – Boolean value. If true, the core_treatment feature will not be penalized by any ML methods used for treatment effect estimation
  • scale_core (Bool) – Scale core feature to be normalized with variance 1 before creating interactions. If false, do not scale.
expand_coeff(coeff)¶

pricingengine.variables.own_var module¶

class pricingengine.variables.own_var.OwnVar(treatment_column, lag=0, seasonal_diff=0, interaction_levels=None, unpenalize_core_treatment=False, scale_core=True)¶

Bases: pricingengine.variables.var_builder.VarBuilder

Measure impact of a unit’s own treatment value

__init__(treatment_column, lag=0, seasonal_diff=0, interaction_levels=None, unpenalize_core_treatment=False, scale_core=True)¶
Parameters:
  • lag – 0 spcified contemporaneous treatment, positive values lagged treatments, negative values future treatments
  • lag – lag of variable to use
  • seasonal_difference – seasonal_difference to use in constructing variable. If zero, do not use a seasonal difference.
  • interaction_levels – List of lists. Each sub-list is a list of columns that will be collectively interacted. If a sub-list is of length 2, this correspodns to a second-order interaction.
  • unpenalize_core_treatment – Boolean value. If true, the core_treatment feature will not be penalized by any ML methods used for treatment effect estimation
  • scale_core (Bool) – Scale core feature to be normalized with variance 1 before creating interactions. If false, do not scale.

pricingengine.variables.p_to_p_var module¶

class pricingengine.variables.p_to_p_var.PToPVar(treatment_column, competition_var, impact_dict, lag=0, seasonal_diff=0, interaction_levels=None, unpenalize_core_treatment=False, scale_core=True)¶

Bases: pricingengine.variables.var_builder.VarBuilder

Class used to measure impact of the treatment value assigned to a particular peer for a particular self

TOSTRING = '_to_'¶
TREATMENT = 'treatment'¶
__init__(treatment_column, competition_var, impact_dict, lag=0, seasonal_diff=0, interaction_levels=None, unpenalize_core_treatment=False, scale_core=True)¶

Initialize a new FeatureBuilder for datasets with the specified schema

Parameters:
  • treatment_column – Name of treatment variable to be used.
  • competition_var – A panel variable (usually item) along the dimension of which a cross-instance competition is allowed
  • impact_dict – Dictionary of impactor to impacted pairs where both the impactor and impacted are values of the competition_var
  • lag – lag of variable to use
  • seasonal_difference – seasonal_difference to use in constructing variable. If zero, do not use a seasonal difference.
  • interaction_levels – List of lists. Each sub-list is a list of columns that will be collectively interacted. If a sub-list is of length 2, this correspodns to a second-order interaction.
  • unpenalize_core_treatment – Boolean value. If true, the core_treatment feature will not be penalized by any ML methods used for treatment effect estimation
  • scale_core (Bool) – Scale core feature to be normalized with variance 1 before creating interactions. If false, do not scale.

pricingengine.variables.peer_agg_var module¶

class pricingengine.variables.peer_agg_var.PeerAggVar(treatment_column, competition_var, hierarchy_col=None, lag=0, seasonal_diff=0, aux_col_name=None, bandwidth=None, kernel=None, interaction_levels=None, unpenalize_core_treatment=False, store_weights=True, weighting_column=None, scale_core=True)¶

Bases: pricingengine.variables.var_builder.VarBuilder

Class used to measure weighted average impact of the treatment value assigned to one’s peers

HIERARCHY = 'hier'¶
INSTANCE_PTREATMENT = 'p_treat'¶
INSTANCE_PTREATMENTxREV_WEIGHT = 'p_treat * rev weight'¶
INSTANCE_REVENUE = 'rev'¶
INSTANCE_REV_WEIGHT = 'rev weight'¶
N_TO_1_REV_AUX_WEIGHTED = 'Nto1 Revenue*Aux Weighted'¶
N_TO_1_REV_WEIGHTED = 'Nto1 Revenue Weighted'¶
N_TO_1_UNWEIGHTED = 'Nto1 Unweighted'¶
WINDOW_SIZE = 2¶
__init__(treatment_column, competition_var, hierarchy_col=None, lag=0, seasonal_diff=0, aux_col_name=None, bandwidth=None, kernel=None, interaction_levels=None, unpenalize_core_treatment=False, store_weights=True, weighting_column=None, scale_core=True)¶

Initialize a new FeatureBuilder for datasets with the specified schema

Parameters:
  • core_treatment – Name of treatment variable to be used.
  • competition_var – A panel variable (usually item) along the dimension of which a cross-instance competition (or alternatively spill-over effects) is allowed
  • hierarchy_var – A categorical variable that groups products and defines the structure of competition. If omitted all instances with the same conditioning variables will be allowed to compete.
  • aux_col_name – Name of a numerical column which is used to “weight” cross product effects. I.E. Products closer to each other in this column are presumed to compete/complement more strongly.
  • bandwidth – A positive float used to divide distance in the aux_column before applying the kernel. Larger values will allow for more disperese products to compete with each other.
  • kernel – A lambda function that converts distance (in the aux col name) to a weighting. Default is a Gaussian PDF.
  • interaction_levels – List of lists. Each sub-list is a list of columns that will be collectively interacted. If a sub-list is of length 2, this correspodns to a second-order interaction.
  • unpenalize_core_treatment – Boolean value. If ture, the core_treatment feature will not be penalized by any ML methods used for treatment effect estimation
  • store_weights – If True, stores the needed cross-treatment weights inside this class. This takes up space, but allows the build method to run faster on future computations.
  • weighting_column – Additional column used to weight effects. May desire to use revenue-weighting if trying to approximate IIA structure of demand in estiamting cross-price effects.
  • scale_core (Bool) – Scale core feature to be normalized with variance 1 before creating interactions. If false, do not scale.
lag_feature_from_outcome¶

pricingengine.variables.var_builder module¶

class pricingengine.variables.var_builder.VarBuilder(treatment_column, interaction_levels=None, unpenalize_core_treatment=False, scale_core=True)¶

__init__(treatment_column, interaction_levels=None, unpenalize_core_treatment=False, scale_core=True)¶

Initialize a new FeatureBuilder for datasets with the specified schema

Parameters:
  • core_treatment – Name of treatment variable to be used
  • interactor (Interactor) – Instance of interactor class that specified how core pull forward feature is interacted
  • unpenalize_core_treatment – Boolean value. If true, the core_treatment feature will not be penalized by any ML methods used for treatment effect estimation
build(estimation_dataset, encoders, treatments=None, panel=None, outcome_lead=0)¶

Build the feature(s) for the given dataset

Parameters:
  • estimation_dataset – The estimation_dataset from which to build the features
  • encoders – Encoders used to create dummies from categorical variables
  • treatments – Raw treatment residuals used to create treatment features
  • panel –
  • outcome_lead –
Returns:

A list of series with an index mathcing that of the input dataset and the computed feature values
